text:
Hey there. I used to build my documentation for InformationGeometry.jl via Travis and had everything running perfectly until I ran out of Travis credits recently and am now trying to switch to building with github actions.

I've added the necessary .yml file, the "Build and deploy" action is triggered as intended, the build itself is successful, but the deployment fails:
```┌ Error: Git failed to fetch git@github.com:RafaelArutjunjan/InformationGeometry.jl.git
│ This can be caused by a DOCUMENTER_KEY variable that is not correctly set up.
│ Make sure that the environment variable is properly set up as a Base64-encoded string
│ of the SSH private key. You may need to re-generate the keys with DocumenterTools.
└ @ Documenter ~/.julia/packages/Documenter/FuXcO/src/Documenter.jl:554```
Now I'm no expert on the inner workings of Documenter.jl or the github actions system, but the documentation of Documenter.jl makes it sound like the DOCUMENTER_KEY is only really necessary for use with Travis CI? Do I even need it if I use github actions to build and deploy docs?

So do I generate a new key? Do I just delete the old one I have set up or does that then break something else, like the TagBot? Do I have to adjust any .yml files?

I would be grateful for any guidance on this.

elements.text:
Hey there. I used to build my documentation for InformationGeometry.jl via Travis and had everything running perfectly until I ran out of Travis credits recently and am now trying to switch to building with github actions.

I've added the necessary .yml file, the "Build and deploy" action is triggered as intended, the build itself is successful, but the deployment fails:

┌ Error: Git failed to fetch git@github.com:RafaelArutjunjan/InformationGeometry.jl.git
│ This can be caused by a DOCUMENTER_KEY variable that is not correctly set up.
│ Make sure that the environment variable is properly set up as a Base64-encoded string
│ of the SSH private key. You may need to re-generate the keys with DocumenterTools.
└ @ Documenter ~/.julia/packages/Documenter/FuXcO/src/Documenter.jl:554

Now I'm no expert on the inner workings of Documenter.jl or the github actions system, but the documentation of Documenter.jl makes it sound like the DOCUMENTER_KEY is only really necessary for use with Travis CI? Do I even need it if I use github actions to build and deploy docs?

So do I generate a new key? Do I just delete the old one I have set up or does that then break something else, like the TagBot? Do I have to adjust any .yml files?

I would be grateful for any guidance on this.

text:
I think you have to generate a new key and add it to the secrets <https://juliadocs.github.io/Documenter.jl/dev/man/hosting/#GitHub-Actions> :
>  You can generate the key in the same way, and then set the encoded key as a secret environment variable in your repository settings.

elements.text: I think you have to generate a new key and add it to the secrets
You can generate the key in the same way, and then set the encoded key as a secret environment variable in your repository settings.

text:
Ah yes! I also just found <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/latest-version-of-docs-not-published-github-actions-tagbot/50634/18>
which made me realize that while I had set up the secret key for Travis, I did not also save it as a repository secret on github.

Thanks very much, I'm sure that must have been the problem and it should probably work fine from now on. :+1:

attachments.title: Latest version of docs not published (github actions/TagBot)
attachments.text: To build the documentation on old tags that have already been created, see the “Fixing broken release deployments” subsection under the Documentation Versions section of this page.
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Latest version of docs not published (github actions/TagBot)

elements.text: Ah yes! I also just found

which made me realize that while I had set up the secret key for Travis, I did not also save it as a repository secret on github.

Thanks very much, I'm sure that must have been the problem and it should probably work fine from now on.

text: (and you can probably delete the old travis one)

elements.text: (and you can probably delete the old travis one)

text: Yep, it's working now, thanks again.

elements.text: Yep, it's working now, thanks again.
